data.title: The Bladerunner by Alan E Nourse
data.meta_description: The Bladerunner by Nourse, Alan E. and a great selection of related books, art and collectibles available now at AbeBooks.com.
data.text:
Soft cover. Condition: Very Good. 1st Edition. First mass market paper edition, first printing. The basis for William S. Burroughs' "Blade Runner: a Movie." Very Good to Very Good+, light edgewear; spine solid but with numerous reading creases and a couple of small color losses; two small color chips out of lower edge of rear wraps. A clean and cosmetically worn copy.

Condition: Good. Book is in Used-Good condition. Pages and cover are clean and intact. Used items may not include supplementary materials such as CDs or access codes. May show signs of minor shelf wear and contain limited notes and highlighting. 0.25.

Condition: Good. SHIPS FROM USA. Used books have different signs of use and do not include supplemental materials such as CDs, Dvds, Access Codes, charts or any other extra material. All used books might have various degrees of writing, highliting and wear and tear and possibly be an ex-library with the usual stickers and stamps. Dust Jackets are not guaranteed and when still present, they will have various degrees of tear and damage. All images are Stock Photos, not of the actual item. book.

Paperback. Condition: Good. No Jacket. First edition THUS, first printing. Shelf and handling wear to cover and binding, with general signs of previous use. No extraneous markings. All pages are intact and binding is strong. Secure packaging for safe delivery. 0.5.

Paperback. Condition: Collectable, very good. 1st. Almost like new. First printing. Signed by Nourse on title page. As new except very faint hinge crease on front cover. ** We are a small family business selling fine new and pre-owned books online since 1999. We provide professional service and individual attention to your order, daily shipments, and sturdy packaging. FREE TRACKING ON ALL SHIPMENTS WITHIN USA. **Your purchase supports our town's public library.

Hardcover. Condition: Very Good. Dust Jacket Condition: Near Fine. 1st Edition. Minimally marked ex-library copy with faint tape ghosts to the red paper covered boards, library stamp to free endpaper and title page, small ink numbers to rear fixed endpaper with the book title printed in a tiny neat hand below; no other interior markings. The dust wrapper is well preserved, NEAR FINE with the $6.95 publication price intact to front flap corner. McCay was a small publishing house and their print runs were likewise small. Photos on request.

Hardcover. Condition: Very Good. Dust Jacket Condition: Near Fine. Schick, Joel (illustrator). 1st Edition. 1st printing. A rather nice copy for an Ex-Library. Moderate wear around the edges, some tape marks on the boards, and a few library stamps on the title and copyright pages as well as some glue residue where the pocket was removed from the rear flyleaf. The spine is straight and the remaining pages are clean, bright, and unmarked. The dust jacket has some scuff marks on the back side of the paper, but otherwise has only minimal wear and no tears.
